classic.name: National Museum of Scotland
classic.description: Bright, modern museum housing Scottish industrial history relics, natural history displays & a cafe.

classic.name: Royal Mile
classic.description: Buzzing street linking Edinburgh Castle with Holyrood Palace, lined with quaint eateries & shops.

classic.name: Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh
classic.description: Manicured 70-acre gardens with palm house and temporary exhibitions, kids' events, tours and cafes.

classic.name: Scott Monument
classic.description: Spirelike Victorian memorial in honour of the writer Sir Walter Scott, with 287 steps to the top.
classic.address: E. Princes St Gardens, Edinburgh EH2 2EJ, UK

classic.name: Surgeons' Hall Museums
classic.description: Classical 1832 building housing 18th-century anatomy specimens & visiting medical exhibitions.
classic.address: Surgeons Hall Museums, Nicolson St, Edinburgh EH8 9DW, UK

classic.name: National Galleries Scotland: Portrait
classic.description: Scots history & celebrity portraits in a grand, red-stone Victorian gallery with a shop & cafe.

classic.name: Greyfriars Kirkyard Cemetery Edinburgh
classic.description: Church with a shop & museum, telling the story of the famously loyal dog, Greyfriars Bobby.

foodie.name: Makars Mash Bar
foodie.description: Unfussy restaurant specialising in mashed potatoes flavoured with meat or vegetarian toppings.

foodie.name: Dishoom Edinburgh
foodie.address: 3a St Andrew Sq, Edinburgh EH2 2BD, UK

foodie.name: Room Rumours Coffee
foodie.address: Arch 13, 25 E Market St, Edinburgh EH8 8FS, UK

foodie.name: The Dome
foodie.description: Corinthian columns, marble bars and palms in separate rooms for fine dining, light lunches or teas.

foodie.name: The Edinburgh Larder - Blackfriars Street
foodie.description: Relaxed cafe for artisan coffee, and local, seasonal produce for breakfast & lunch.

foodie.name: Bertie's Proper Fish & Chips
foodie.description: Stylish, bi-level stop offering a hearty seafood classics alongside a kids' menu & a full bar.

foodie.name: The Devil's Advocate
foodie.description: Cosy, brick-lined pub boasting 300+ whiskies, plus burgers, meat dishes & craft cocktails.

foodie.name: The Milkman
foodie.description: Warm option offering thoughtfully sourced coffee & pastries in a restored brick-walled candy shop.

foodie.name: Dynamic Earth
foodie.description: State-of-the-art family attraction taking visitors through history from the Big Bang to modern day.

adventure.name: Holyrood Park
adventure.description: Parkland around the slopes & crags of Arthur's Seat, with walking & cycling paths & a loch.

adventure.name: Pentland Hills Regional Park
adventure.description: Regional park featuring 9 peaks of over 1500 feet & offering views of Edinburgh & surrounding area.

adventure.name: Princes Street Gardens
adventure.description: Green Flag park of geological/botanical interest, home to several public monuments and memorials.

adventure.name: The Meadows
adventure.description: Public park includes children's playground, sports pitches, cricket square, with annual summer fair.

adventure.name: Water of Leith Path
adventure.description: 12-mile path that runs alongside the small Water of Leith river & popular with walkers & cyclists.

adventure.name: Dalkeith Country Park
adventure.description: Vast park on a historical estate featuring a kids' adventure park, a cafe & an upscale gift shop.
adventure.address: Via Town Gate, Dalkeith EH22 2NA, UK

adventure.name: Edinburgh Zoo
adventure.description: Large parkland zoo offering keeper talks, hands-on animal encounters and free hilltop safari rides.
adventure.address: 134 Corstorphine Rd, Corstorphine, Edinburgh EH12 6TS, UK

adventure.name: Corstorphine Hill Local Nature Reserve
adventure.description: Benches mark this small hiking-path pit stop on Corstorphine Hill for views of Edinburgh.
